original_title: An Electric Unicycle, In Minimalist Form
original_content:
When self balancing scooters hit the market a few years ago they brought alongside them a range of machines, from the hoverboard kids toys which have provided so many useful parts, to the stand-astride electric unicycles. These last machines have a bulky battery and controller box atop the wheel, and [Dycus] set his sights on this by transferring it to a backpack with the vehicles IMU sensor relocated to one of the pedals.
Such a job is not merely a simple case of rewiring with some longer cables, as a first challenge the IMU communicates via I2C which isnt suitable for longer distances. This is solved by a chipset which places the I2C on a differential pair, but even then its not quite a case of stepping on and zipping about. The PID parameters of the balancing algorithm on a stock machine are tuned for the extra weight of the battery on top, and these needed to be modified. Fortunately there have been enough people hacking the STM microcontroller and firmware involved for this task to be achievable, but wed rate it as still something not for the faint-hearted.
The final result can be seen in the video below, and the quality of the physical work shows as very high. The former battery box is repurposed into a stylish backpack, and though the newly minimalist foot pedals and wheel are a little less easy to get going he zips around with ease.
Hungry for more? This aint the first weve shown you.
title: 「ホバーボードの部品活用！電動一輪車をバックパック化」
body: 自己バランス型スクーターはいくつかのマシンを市場にもたらしました。バッテリーとコントローラーボックスは、[Dycus]がバックパックに移動させるよう工夫しました。PIDパラメーターを調整する必要があります。バランスアルゴリズムはストックマシンの重量に合わせて調整されています。最終結果は素晴らしく、バッテリーボックスはスタイリッシュなバックパックに再利用されています。
